title: Neurogen Biomarking: The Company That’s Changing the Future of Brain Health
description: Headquartered in Chicago, the company’s mission is clear: to make early detection of Alzheimer’s and other neurodegenerative diseases not only possible, but routine.
content:
Alzheimer’s disease is not just a medical crisis. It is a human one. It affects nearly 7 million Americans today, yet the overwhelming majority are diagnosed only after the disease has taken hold. Behind the statistics are families left scrambling, lives rerouted, and systems overwhelmed. For Dr. Rany Aburashed, a practicing neurologist and researcher, this failure to act early was no longer acceptable.

In 2024, he founded Neurogen Biomarking to change that reality permanently. Headquartered in Chicago, the company’s mission is clear: to make early detection of Alzheimer’s and other neurodegenerative diseases not only possible, but routine. Their belief is simple. Brain health should be proactive, not reactive. And timing is everything.

Rebuilding Brain Health from the Ground Up

Neurogen’s approach represents a full rethinking of how cognitive decline is detected, understood, and acted upon. Rather than waiting for symptoms to appear and escalate, the company has developed an at-home ecosystem built for speed, scale, and science.

A small blood sample is used to measure pTau217, a biomarker shown to correlate with early Alzheimer’s pathology. This is paired with digital cognitive assessments and a telehealth consultation with a board-certified neurologist. The process delivers insight without the need for hospital visits or long wait times.

More importantly, it empowers families at the very moment they need clarity most.

“We’re not in the business of delivering test results,” says Dr. Aburashed. “We’re in the business of delivering time. Time to plan, time to act, time to preserve quality of life.”

Neurogen is not merely entering the diagnostics field; it is working to establish a new approach to care where early insights could become a key component of clinical practice. The company’s operational model reflects that ambition. Its leadership team includes startup and scientific veterans like Dr. Ken Bahk and Dr. Elisabeth Thijssen.

Already, the company has surpassed 500 completed tests through its beta program, claiming a 98 percent satisfaction rate and more than 1,000 individuals on the waitlist prior to launch.

The most urgent insight behind Neurogen’s mission is this: 92 percent of Alzheimer’s patients are diagnosed too late to benefit from disease-modifying therapies or meaningful intervention. Neurogen exists for that 92 percent.

With every test, interpretation, and family reached, Neurogen is contributing to the evolving standard of care. One where cognitive screening is as normalized as a cholesterol check. One where early detection becomes a right, not a privilege.

Neurogen Biomarking is not only addressing a medical gap but also laying the groundwork for a future in brain health, focused on access, timing, and practical solutions.

This article is for informational purposes only and does not substitute for professional medical advice. If you are seeking medical advice, diagnosis or treatment, please consult a medical professional or healthcare provider.
summary: Neurogen Biomarking, a Chicago-based company, aims to make early detection of Alzheimer's and other neurodegenerative diseases more routine. The company's approach involves a thorough rethinking of how cognitive decline is detected, understood, and acted upon. Instead of waiting for symptoms to escalate, Neurogen uses a small blood sample to measure pTau217, a biomarker shown to correlate with early Alzheimer's pathology, paired with digital cognitive assessments and a telehealth consultation with a board-certified neurologist. Neurogen's CEO, Dr. Rany Aburashed, believes that the company is in the business of delivering time, rather than delivering test results, and empowers families at the moment they need clarity.
shortSummary: Neurogen Biomarking, founded by Dr. Rany Aburashed, aims to address the urgent need to detect early Alzheimer’s disease and improve patient care by providing predictive, context-based testing.

scraped_sources.text:
Early Alzheimer's detection means more
Take control of your brain health, and give yourself the chance for more time and better care.
Get started now
Take the first step to getting your Neurogen At-Home Test Kit today.
Already have a kit?
We're here to guide you at every step, starting with how to use your kit.
So much more than a test kit
Neurogen offers a personalized brain health care ecosystem to support early detection of dementia due to Alzheimer's, including innovative cognitive testing and the opportunity to connect to world- class care.
At-home testing
We make early detection simple, with testing that includes an easy-to-use at-home blood test and an online cognitive assessment.sss
A Home Blood-Draw specialist will contact you by phone to schedule your At-Home Blood Draw at a time convenient to you.
Neurologist consultation
Your test results will be individually assessed by a board-certified neurologist, who will set up an appointment to review them with you, as needed.
Access to experts
With Neurogen, you gain access to a team of providers specialty trained in the most recent advancements in cognitive care.
A little testing makes a big difference
A little testing makes a big difference
Earlier Intervention
Our at-home test gives you the gift of time, enabling you to get care years earlier than in the past.
Empower Your Health
Knowing more gives you the chance to make lifestyle changes, which may reduce your risk of cognitive decline and dementia by up to 60%.1
More Effective Care
With earlier detection, you can take advantage of new treatments for Alzheimer’s, which are most effective in the early stages.
Maintain Independence
Give yourself more time to find strategies and tools to maximize your independence.
Ready to get started?
Early Alzheimer’s detection can make a world of a difference. Get started by requesting our easy-to-use At-Home Test Kit.
Have questions?
You have questions, we have the answers. Visit our FAQ page to learn more.
1 Combination of healthy lifestyle traits may substantially reduce Alzheimer's, National Institutes of Health, https://www.nih.gov/news-events/news-releases/combination-healthy-lifestyle-traits-may-substantially-reduce-alzheimers.
2 2 Alzheimer's and Dementia. Alzheimer's Association. https://www.alz.org/alzheimer_s_dementia

“When I first found out I had a medical condition I probably went through 4 residents and never really got the chance to establish a relationship with any doctor to help take care of my condition. It became frustrating to constantly have to explain myself over and over about the condition and how I felt daily to several different people. At one point I was just over seeing so many different people so I researched a neurologist and decided to go with Rany. Finding him was one of the best decisions I had made. He is a awesome doctor to work with and he truly cares about his patients. I feel that he is extremely knowledgeable in his work and does a great job of explaining the type of care you need. I felt great when I walked out that office. I have yet to find a doctor such as him in my new state, but he is great at what he does. ”

argos_summary: Neurogen Biomarking, founded by neurologist Dr. Rany Aburashed, offers an at‑home early‑detection system for Alzheimer’s that combines a blood test for pTau217, digital cognitive assessments, and a telehealth neurologist review. The company’s goal is to make routine, proactive brain health screening as common as a cholesterol check, addressing the fact that 92% of Alzheimer’s patients are diagnosed too late for effective treatment. With over 500 completed beta tests, a 98% satisfaction rate, and a growing waitlist, Neurogen aims to shift the standard of care toward earlier intervention and better quality of life for patients and families.
